contentrichtext.text: {{unsourced|date=January 2009}} {{Japanese name|Mizuno}} {{nihongo|'''Mizuno Tadashige'''|水野 忠重|extra=1541 – August 27, 1600}} was a retainer of the [[Japan]]ese clan of [[Tokugawa clan|Tokugawa]] following the later years of the [[Azuchi-Momoyama period]] of the 16th century. Tadashige was the son of [[Mizuno Tadamasa]] and the brother of [[Mizuno Nobumoto]]. He was at one time given his brother's [[fief]] of [[Kariya, Aichi|Kariya]] in [[Mikawa province|Mikawa]]. He was killed by [[Kagai Hidemasa]] following the [[Sekigahara Campaign]] of 1600. {{openhistory}} {{Persondata | NAME = Mizuno Tadashige | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = | DATE OF BIRTH = 1541 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = 1600 | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Mizuno, Tadashige}} [[Category:1541 births]] [[Category:1600 deaths]] [[Category:Place of birth unknown]] [[Category:Place of death missing]] [[Category:Date of birth unknown]] {{Japan-bio-stub}}
